title: Ancient Greek Terms
description: Test your knowledge of words from ancient Greek civilization, philosophy, and culture

questions.question: In ancient Greece, what was the 'agora'?
options: The central public gathering place and marketplace

questions.question: What was a 'polis' in ancient Greece?
options: A city-state with its own government and identity

questions.question: In Greek philosophy, what did 'logos' primarily mean?
What was an 'oracle' in ancient Greece?
options: A person or place through which a god gave prophecies

questions.question: In ancient Greek society, what was 'ostracism'?
options: The practice of voting to exile a citizen for ten years

questions.question: What was a 'hoplite' in ancient Greece?
options: A heavily armed foot soldier who fought in formation

questions.question: In Greek culture, what was a 'symposium'?
options: A social gathering for drinking, music, and intellectual discussion

questions.question: What did 'demokratia' mean in ancient Athens?
In ancient Greece, what was 'hubris'?
options: Excessive pride or arrogance, especially defying the gods

questions.question: What was an 'amphora' in ancient Greece?
options: A two-handled storage jar for wine or olive oil

questions.question: In Greek philosophy, what did 'eudaimonia' refer to?
What was a 'trireme' in ancient Greece?
options: A warship with three rows of oars on each side

questions.question: In Greek culture, what were the 'Olympics' originally?
options: Athletic competitions held every four years to honor Zeus at Olympia

questions.question: What did 'arete' mean in ancient Greek?
options: Excellence or virtue, the highest potential of a person

questions.question: In ancient Greece, what was the 'Acropolis'?
options: A fortified hilltop serving as a city's religious and cultural center
